It belongs to the family Benstoneaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often near the bases of trees or in undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Benstonea sylvatica is considered a conservation concern in many regions.
